liber.name: Name
liber.alert: Too many points allocated to HP and/or PSY!
liber.alert1: Agility and Strength must be equal to Physique
liber.alert2: Charisma and Sagacity must be equal to Social
liber.alert3: Cunning and Memory must be equal to Mental
liber.avantrace0: +5 in agility, +5 in stealth, small size about 1m.
liber.avantrace3: Knowledge of the underworld, inspires fear - Fear 10
liber.avantrace5: Damage/2, Insensitive to magic, -20 in stealth, No magic
liber.avantrace10: Can only be healed by blood (1d6), only once per creature - Agility 5
liber.avantrace15: Natural camouflage - Vulnerable to fire - Nature Knowledge 5
liber.avantrace17: Can only be harmed by magic, when out of PSY dies
liber.avantrace18: Can only be healed by blood (1d6), Searching: 5
liber.avantrace27: - Knowledge of creatures of this world
liber.avantrace59b: - Nocturnal orientation + 5% roll under the stars
liber.lang17: in a military camp away from the city
liber.lang18: on the roads, traveling from town to town
liber.lang20: you learn about your heavy past
liber.lang21: you leave your clan to travel and discover the world
liber.lang22: you get captured by an enemy clan
liber.lang23: you are recruited by a strange character for a certain mission
liber.lang25: you consult an oracle, which reveals strange revelations to you
liber.lang26: your father dies during a battle
liber.lang27: you get kidnapped by a stranger
liber.lang28: you go missing during a battle
liber.lang29: falls victim to an assassination attempt
liber.lang30: during an accident you lose your memory
liber.lang32: you discover an unwavering faith in your god within yourself
liber.lang34: to bring peace to your clan
liber.lang35: to find a way for your name to remain in memory
liber.lang36: to kill the people responsible for your misfortunes
liber.lang38: to annihilate people you deem too weak
liber.lang40: to seek revenge for the wrongs done to you
liber.lang43: to become the strongest in your clan
liber.lang45: to spread your faith to the unbelievers
liber.lang48: fascinated by the culture of other clans
liber.lang49: driven by a thirst for knowledge
liber.lang63: Lexrung, you are a free spirit and independent.
liber.lang64: Lexegar, you are altruistic and feel obligated to help others.
liber.lang65: Lexerha, you are peaceful and prefer non-violent solutions to conflicts.
liber.lang66: Lexas, you are thoughtful and calm by nature, your advice is always given with wisdom.
liber.lang67: Lexweqi, you are a brilliant hunter, easily tracking your prey.
liber.lang68: Lexaly, you are quick-witted and react promptly in all circumstances.
liber.lang69: Lexoulha, you are very social and enjoy the pleasures of life.
liber.lang70: Lexora, you have great determination to accomplish things, you are stubborn and resolute.
liber.lang71: Lexauch, you are superstitious, often relying on luck and chance.
liber.lang72: Lexaxas, you are nervous and often angry. You often choose violence to solve problems.
liber.lang73: Lexang, you are a skilled craftsman, possessing great skill in creating various objects.
liber.lang74: Lexug, you are vengeful, you do not forget the harm done to you and are not afraid to make others pay.
liber.lang75: Lexoelia, you easily trust others, brotherhood is one of your great values.
liber.lang76: Lexaug, you are protective of your family and home.
liber.lang86: Moves to offensive stance, heading into the fray!
liber.lang87: Is cautious, assumes a defensive stance.
liber.lang90: Delays their action, ready to act.
liber.title1: +20% to agility as long as not wearing armor
liber.title3: Allows to wield two weapons without penalties
liber.title4: Gets 5 additional skill points per level up
liber.title5: Can wield a magical weapon that strikes mentally (damage 1d6+2), without using psyche, concealed in a jewel
liber.title6: Grants an additional action per turn with a -20 penalty
liber.title8: Finds what they are looking for in a book/library (without rolling dice), +20 to memory checks
liber.title9: Recovers 6 HP and 3 PSY when sleeping
liber.title10: Re-rolls a failed luck check (once per roll), one automatic success per day
liber.title11: Does not need to make a riding check while fighting from a mount
liber.title12: Can attack after a successful defense roll
liber.title13: HP can be used as psyche without penalty.
liber.title14: Grants an additional parry per turn
liber.title17: Re-rolls a failed observation check (once per roll), finds more items on bodies
liber.title19: Can repair weapons and armor and craft them, with the necessary materials.
liber.title20: Player can re-roll 2 initiative checks and keep the better result
liber.title21: Immune to diseases and poison, magical damage taken is halved.
liber.title22: Can flee from combat without making a physique check, faster escape. +20 to dodge.
liber.title26: Any enemy engaged in combat with the player, trying to move or flee, will suffer an additional attack
liber.title27: Re-rolls a failed social check (once per roll)
liber.title28: Can make a mental perception check to detect any magical disturbances (magical traps, scrolls, mages)
liber.title30: Can bypass armor when the opponent has not detected you
liber.title32: Gives a 20% bonus to all Sneak, Treachery, backstabbing attacks etc...
liber.title33: Can increase healing or damage effect +2 (in one of the 15 elements)
liber.title34: Grants additional damage on a weapon of your choice
liber.title35: When the player loses consciousness, they regain 1 HP (once per day)
liber.title36: Does not suffer penalties when shooting from a distance
liber.title37: Player can re-roll a failed fear check
liber.title44: Carrier of a disease, loses 1d4 HP per day if treatment is not taken. Magical damage doubled.
liber.title45: Player can re-roll 2 initiative checks and keep the lower result
liber.title46: Re-rolls a successful luck check (once per roll), one automatic failure per day
liber.title51: Flees from combat if more than half of HP is lost
liber.title52: Automatically detected during movements, triggers traps
liber.title53: -5 HP at the start of the game
liber.title54: Allies do not regain HP and PSY when player sleeps
liber.title55: Increases critical failure chance of allies by 5%
liber.title56: Cannot flee from combat. -20 to dodge and parry.
liber.title58a: +20% to agility as long as not wearing armor
liber.title59a: Can create 1d4 potions (excluding poisons) per day
liber.title61a: 5 additional skill points per level up
liber.title62a: Allows for a magical weapon dealing mental damage (1d6+2), no psyche points required, concealed in a jewel
liber.title63a: Grants an additional action per turn with a -20 penalty
liber.title65a: Automatically finds what is searched for in a book/library (without dice rolls), +20 to memory checks
liber.title66a: Recovers 6 HP and 3 PSY when sleeping
liber.title67a: Re-rolls a failed luck check (once per roll), one automatic success per day
liber.title68a: No need to make a riding check while fighting from a mount
liber.title69a: Allows to attack after a successful defense roll
liber.title70a: Can use HP as PSY without penalty
liber.title71a: Grants an additional parry per turn
liber.title74a: Re-rolls a failed observation check (once per roll), finds more items on bodies
liber.title76a: Can repair weapons and armor and make them, with the necessary materials
liber.title77a: Player can re-roll 2 initiative checks and keep the best
liber.title78a: Immune to diseases and poison, magical damage suffered halved
liber.title79a: Can flee from combat without making a physical check, faster escape. +20 to dodge.
liber.title83a: Every enemy engaged in combat with the player suffers an additional +2 damage
liber.title84a: Re-rolls a failed social check (once per roll)
liber.title85a: Can make a mental perception test to detect any magical disturbance (magic trap, scroll, mage)
liber.title86a: Can move silently, does not trigger traps
liber.title87a: Allows to pierce the opponent's armor when they have not seen you. +20 to cunning
liber.title89a: Grants a 20% bonus to all sneakiness, treachery, backstabbing, etc. checks
liber.title90a: Can increase the healing or damage effect by +2 (in one of the 15 elements)
liber.title91a: Grants +4 additional damage to a weapon of choice
liber.title92a: When the player loses consciousness, they regain 1 HP (once per day)
liber.title93a: No penalty for shooting from afar, +2 for ranged weapons.
liber.title94a: Can make a strength saving throw to avoid death (damage nullified), once per day
liber.title01a: Carries a disease, loses 1d4 HP per day if treatment is not taken. Magical damage is doubled.
liber.title02a: Player can re-roll 2 initiative checks and keep the worst result
liber.title03a: Re-rolls a successful luck check (once per roll), one automatic failure per day
liber.title08a: Flees from combat if more than half of HP are lost
liber.title09a: Automatically detected during movements, triggers traps
liber.title110a: -5 HP at the beginning of the game
liber.title111a: Allies do not recover HP and PSY when the player sleeps.
liber.title112a: Increases allies' critical failure chance by 5%
liber.title113a: Cannot flee from combat. -20 to dodge and parry.
liber.title114a: -20 to social checks when drunk, -20 to concentration when sober
liber.title115a: Player is the first to be noticed and targeted by enemies.
liber.caract274: Converting the world to one's faith
liber.caract279: Ablutophobia – Fear of bathing. This phobia is more a fear of drowning than a fear of water.
liber.caract280: Acarophobia – Fear of skin parasites, mites.
liber.caract281: Achluophobia – Fear of darkness and black.
liber.caract282: Achmophobia / Aichmophobia – Fear of needles and sharp objects (scissors, knives, syringes for example).
liber.caract283: Acrophobia – Fear of heights; often accompanied by vertigo.
liber.caract284: Administrativophobia – Fear of dealing with administration and administrative letters.
liber.caract286: Aerodromophobia – Fear of flying, of air travel.
liber.caract287: Aerophobia – Fear of air and wind.
liber.caract288: Agoraphobia – Fear of public spaces and, by extension, of crowds; more generally, of spaces where escape is made difficult (crowds, but also deserted places).
liber.caract293: Anginophobia – Fear of choking, especially from angina pectoris.
liber.caract294: Angrophobia – Fear of getting angry in public.
liber.caract297: Anthropophobia – Fear of people or being in their company, a form of social phobia.
liber.caract300: Apopathodiaphulatophobia – Fear of being constipated or of constipation itself.
liber.caract306: Athazagoraphobia – Fear of being forgotten or ignored.
liber.caract308: Automysophobia – Fear of being dirty, of smelling bad.
liber.caract310: Aviophobia – Fear of taking the plane.
liber.caract318: Cardiophobia – Fear of the heart or fear of developing cardiovascular disease.
liber.caract320: Catapedaphobia – Fear of climbing to heights.
liber.caract324: Climacophobia – Fear of using stairs, especially going down them.
liber.caract327: Cyclophobia – Fear of riding a bicycle or any other two-wheeled vehicle.
liber.caract329: Dysmorphophobia / Dysmorphia – Fear of physical anomalies.
liber.caract333: Erythrophobia (or erythrophobia)– Fear of blushing in public.
liber.caract334: Fumiphobia – Fear of smoke (tobacco for example)
liber.caract335: Gephyrophobia – Fear of bridges (or crossing bridges).
liber.caract338: Glossophobia – Fear of speaking in public.
liber.caract339: Graphophobia – Fear of writing (the act of writing).
liber.caract342: Haptophobia (or Aphenphosmophobia) – Fear of being touched.
liber.caract343: Hematophobia – Fear of contact and sight of blood.
liber.caract346: Ithyphallophobia / Medorthophobia – Fear of seeing erect penises.
liber.caract349: Keraunophobia - Morbid fear of lightning and thunderstorms.
liber.caract350: Kopophobia – Fear of being tired, or of fatigue itself.
liber.caract351: Laxophobia – Fear of having urgent diarrhea in public, outside of one's home, and not being able to hold it.
liber.caract352: Leucoselophobia – Fear of the blank page (writer's block).
liber.caract355: Megalophobia – Fear of large objects, large buildings (skyscrapers or cruise ships for example)
liber.caract358: Mysophobia – Fear of dirt, contamination by germs.
liber.caract359: Nanopabulophobia – Fear of garden gnomes with wheelbarrows.
liber.caract364: Nephrophobia – Fear of kidney disease (also Lithophobia).
liber.caract366: Neurophobia – Fear of nervous breakdowns (also Hysterophobia).
liber.caract368: Nomophobia – Fear of being separated from one's mobile phone. This phobia also refers to an excessive fear of laws.
liber.caract369: Nosocomephobia – Fear of hospitals, clinics, and healthcare centers in general.
liber.caract370: Nosophobia – Fear of illness, of being sick.
liber.caract373: Nudophobia – Fear or disapproval of human nudity.
liber.caract378: Odontophobia – Fear of the dentist / of medical or surgical procedures in the mouth.
liber.caract379: Ombilicophobia - Fear of the belly button, cannot stand touching it or seeing it
liber.caract384: Phagophobia – Fear of choking on food.
liber.caract386: Philophobia - Fear of falling in love.
liber.caract388: Protophiphouphobia - Fear of running out of protein.
liber.caract389: Blood-injection-injury phobia – Subtype of specific phobias classified in the DSM-IV.
liber.caract390: Social phobia – Fear of or certain social situations.
liber.caract391: Phobophobia – Fear of being afraid (of being surprised).
liber.caract392: Pogonophobia – Aversion to beards / fear of chin and cheek hair.
liber.caract399: Siderodromophobia – Fear of traveling by train.
liber.caract402: Stasophobia – Fear of having to stand.
liber.caract403: Taphophobia – Fear of graves or of being buried alive.
liber.caract404: Telephone phobia – Fear of answering the phone.
liber.caract410: Trichophobia – Fear of hair and hairiness.
liber.caract416: Apiphobia – Fear of bees; by extension, fear of insects with stingers or that can sting.
liber.caract422: Helicophobia - Fear of snails and slugs.
liber.caract423: Herpetophobia – Fear of reptiles or amphibians.
liber.caract426: Musophobia – Fear of mice or rats.
liber.new1a: Pirates are experts in boarding, able to assault an enemy ship with speed and efficiency. Initiative is 1D6+1.
liber.new2a: Pirates are merciless looters, capable of stripping a ship or town of all its riches in record time. Retrieve all treasures first.
liber.new3a: Pirates are escape experts, able to get out of the most desperate situations through their ingenuity and boldness. +10 in cunning.
liber.new4a: Pirates are often individualistic and unreliable, who may betray their allies for their own gain. Steals an item from an ally per day (other players will not know why the item has disappeared unless they investigate).
liber.new5a: Pirates are often heavy drinkers, which can make them vulnerable to surprise attacks or ambushes.
liber.new6a: Pirates are often rebels who dislike following orders, which can make them difficult to control in a team. Will be wanted in every town or village passed through.
liber.new7a: Closed or narrow environments cause intense panic, -20 in concentration and agility.
liber.new8a: Must consume a substance or perform a specific action regularly, otherwise -20 to all skill checks.
liber.new9a: Difficulty sleeping, gains -1+ level per hour of recovery.
liber.new10a: Reduced tolerance to a specific substance or situation, must perform a physical test if not only half of their HP is lost but every 3 HP to see if they faint.
liber.new11a: Compulsive obsession for a task or an object, which can lead to distractions and problems in other areas. Concentration checks may be requested by the GM at any time.
Unable to speak, which can complicate communication and social interactions.
liber.new12a: Unable to hear, which can complicate communication and social interactions.
liber.new13a: Suspicious of others, which can lead to erratic behavior and difficulties in trusting allies. Believes to see actions, so the GM can influence their behavior.
liber.new14a: Sensitivity to light, -20 in concentration and agility in daylight or in the presence of intense light sources.
liber.new15a: Attracted to fire and unable to resist the urge to light it, which can lead to accidental fires and conflicts with authorities.
liber.new16a: Uncomfortable in the company of others, which can lead to difficulties in social situations and problems forming bonds with others. -20 in Social.
